# Lumanagi Project - Development Instructions

## Project Overview
Lumanagi is a cross-chain trading and prediction platform built with React and TypeScript. The application provides users with trading capabilities, real-time market data, and engagement features.

## Workspace Setup Checklist

- [x] Verify that the copilot-instructions.md file in the .github directory is created.
- [x] Clarify Project Requirements - React + TypeScript, Cross-chain trading, Predictions, User engagement
- [x] Scaffold the Project - Created with Vite + React + TypeScript
- [x] Customize the Project - Core structure and components created
- [x] Install Required Extensions - Extensions from Vite project setup
- [ ] Compile the Project - Pending: npm install and build verification
- [ ] Create and Run Task - Pending: Development and build tasks
- [ ] Launch the Project - Pending: Start dev server
- [ ] Ensure Documentation is Complete - README.md and instructions complete

## Key Files

- `package.json` - Project dependencies and scripts
- `tsconfig.json` - TypeScript configuration
- `vite.config.ts` - Vite build configuration
- `src/App.tsx` - Main application component
- `src/main.tsx` - React application entry point
- `src/App.css` - Application styling

## Commands

- `npm install` - Install dependencies
- `npm run dev` - Start development server
- `npm run build` - Build for production
- `npm run preview` - Preview production build

## Next Steps

1. Run `npm install` to install all project dependencies
2. Run `npm run dev` to start the development server
3. Create components in `src/components/` directory
4. Add pages to `src/pages/` directory
5. Define types in `src/types/` directory
6. Add utility functions to `src/utils/` directory

## Development Notes

- Project uses React with TypeScript for type safety
- Vite provides fast HMR (Hot Module Replacement) for development
- Component styles can be added alongside components or in the `src/styles/` directory
- Use React Router for navigation between pages
